Record.ClassificationPath: Findings_and_Disorders_Kind/Disease, Disorder or Finding/Finding/Other Finding/Symptom/Pain/Pelvic Pain
Pathological Conditions, Signs and Symptoms/Signs and Symptoms/Pain/Pelvic Pain
Record.Description: Pain in the pelvic region of genital and non-genital origin and of organic or psychogenic etiology. Frequent causes of pain are distension or contraction of hollow viscera, rapid stretching of the capsule of a solid organ, chemical irritation, tissue ischemia, and neuritis secondary to inflammatory, neoplastic, or fibrotic processes in adjacent organs. (Kase, Weingold & Gershenson: Principles and Practice of Clinical Gynecology, 2d ed, pp479-508)
